humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report states that 10/10 lymph nodes are positive for metastasis, which corresponds to N3 according to Rule 13: N3 indicates metastases in 4 or more axillary lymph nodes. Therefore, the N stage for this patient's cancer is N3.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The patient has ten examined lymph nodes that demonstrated metastases, which indicates a pathologic N stage of N2. This is based on the American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC) staging system for cancer, where N2 is defined as 'Metastasis in 4 to 9 axillary lymph nodes, or in clinically apparent ipsilateral internal mammary nodes in the absence of axillary metastasis, or in 1 to 3 axillary lymph nodes and in clinically apparent ipsilateral internal mammary nodes in the absence of axillary metastasis.' However, the report does not mention internal mammary node involvement, so we can assume that the N stage is N2 based on the axillary lymph node metastases.
